content.content: MIP55c3-SP13 : Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster  Preamble MIP55c3-SP#: 13 Author(s): @Hajive  Contributors: @Viridian   Tags: spf, viridian-cluster, Endgame Status: Rejected Date Proposed: 2022-12-07 Date Ratified: N/A Amount Requested: 500,000 DAI Recipient Address: TBC on SPF approval Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip-xx-special-purpose-fund-for-developing-proof-of-performance-for-viridian-cluster/19077 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmRLpjTi   Sentence Summary This MIP will set up a Special Purpose Fund of 500k DAI to fund a set of RWA projects to be undertaken by the Viridian Cluster within the 6-month period of Jan 2023 - Jun 2023.  Paragraph Summary This MIP sets up a SPF of 500k DAI which will fund the due diligence, completion, and ongoing management and monitoring of the following projects: MIP65, MIP81, MIP88, and potentially others brought for evaluation to the community where Monetalis will act as Arranger in the next six months. It allows Maker to continue key RWA projects in the interim period until MetaDAOs can be launched and allows the Maker Community to evaluate the work of the Viridian Cluster ahead of a potential adoption of the cluster to a Protector MetaDAO. Importantly, it also allows the resources of the Viridian Cluster to work on the Protector MetaDAO implementation.  Motivation We, the Viridian Cluster, believe it is key in the period until MetaDAOs can be launched that Maker does not lose steam in its engagement with RWA. This SPF is intended to allow the Viridian Cluster to accomplish a set of key Maker RWA projects that we believe are important for Maker’s engagement with RWA. Also it provides essential resources necessary for implementation of the Protector MetaDAO format. In addition, we find it good people risk management to test out a potential MetaDAO Cluster before considering an adoption. This accomplishes all of these.  Special Purpose Fund Name Viridian Cluster Special Purpose Fund  Special Purpose Fund Scope & Credentials  Projects & Funding Break-down     Component Why? Amount (DAI)     Project Manager & Facilitator  @Hajive from MakerGrowth CU will act as the Project Manager & Facilitator for the cluster, whilst phasing out/reducing his Growth CU responsibilities for the European region through this period. Note: MakerGrowth CU will continue to fund the fixed component (not commissions) of DAI compensation and MKR bonus for this resource at least until Jun 23 as per its already allocated budget. 330,000 (total for three resources)   Legal & Compliance Lead  @Kam will, as contractor, act as head of legal and compliance for the projects.Note: @Kam has already been engaged on a project basis working with CUs as well as partner legal teams for legal assessments and reviews.    Credit & Risk Lead  @Kempaj will, as contractor, act as head of credit and risk for the projects.    Professional third party services (Legal, Credit and ALM) Funding relates to professional third-parties providing final legal opinions, credit evaluations and ALM reviews. Note: Top tier law firms/consulting firms with relevant jurisdiction and asset expertise to be engaged based on individual project requirements. 150,000   Admin & Misc Charges related to onboarding and payment processing for professional services/contractors and any other charges (e.g., Travel and Expense   for the management of the cluster during the period 20,000   Total Funding  500,000     Credentials / BIOs   @Hajive is the Growth Core Unit lead for Europe. He has extensive experience with Business Development and Product Strategy across multiple segments of financial markets, including large TradFi firms (JPMorgan and Refinitiv), as well as fast scaling Crypto CeFi firms (Wirex and Luno, a DCG Company).  @Kam is an English qualified and practising lawyer; she has over 14 years of professional experience and a track record of working on debt transactions delivery in the global financial services industry. She has held senior legal counsel positions, on a contract basis, with Barclays Bank and HSBC. In recent years, Kam has also worked for various DeFi projects, including AllianceBlock.  @Kempaj has a 30 year career in banking and European credit fund management. He has directly managed and led teams managing European corporate credit exposure in a variety of financial institutions. He has experience of working with private equity sponsors, super-national financial institutions, hedge funds, and commercial banks, including Lloyds Bank and the European Investment Bank.   Notes   @SebVentures, as a Viridian cluster member, is already fully budgeted for via the Strategic Finance Core Unit (SF-001) budget and hence there is no additional funding requirement for this resource. The cluster will work in partnership with SF-001 and in support of SF-001’s expanded mandate regarding RWAs.   Funding Return Rules  Excess funds will be held in the multisig until the work is complete. Unspent funds will be returned to the Surplus Buffer.   Special Purpose Fund Details Official Contact or Group Name: Viridian Cluster Special Purpose Fund Contact Email/Handle: @hajive Date Added: XX Total Amount: 500,000 Dai Wallet Address: To be setup Comptroller signers: @SebVentures, @Patrick_J (https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip-xx-special-purpose-fund-for-developing-proof-of-performance-for-viridian-cluster/19077/6)

content.content: So assuming the following:  Clusters must be voted in by MetaDAO token holders before becoming metaDAO admin teams. Maker intends for the initial MetaDAO admin teams to be fairly selected from among any potential clusters.  Do you not feel that specific clusters receiving funds from MakerDAO represents MakerDAO essentially picking winners? At the very least, it gives some clusters an advantage over others. If some clusters have been pre-funded by MakerDAO, I imagine I would rather use any MetaDAO tokens I farmed/bought/owned to onboard them as my MetaDAO admin team, than an alternative cluster that hadn’t received prior funding from MakerDAO. Clearly they would be more favoured by MakerCore and therefore more likely to receive support moving forwards. If we’re proposing funding clusters prior to their being onboarded to MetaDAOs, perhaps it should be done equally?  To be clear, this is not really a criticism of Viridian, or this proposal generally. My points are mainly:  Thus far everyone has been extremely careful to emphasize that MetaDAO token holders choose a cluster to onboard as their MetaDAO admin team, rather than it being a decision of MakerDAO. If certain clusters have been directly funded by MakerDAO, and the fruits of that funding will be reaped by MetaDAO token holders that vote to onboard that cluster as their MetaDAO admin team; then how is this not just Maker indirectly bribing MetaDAO token holders to onboard the clusters that MakerDAO favours?

content.content: Hi @LongForWisdom , What we are looking to achieve with this SPF is to allow for the continuation of momentum with onboarding or at least professional evaluation of RWA projects whilst the organizational details and mechanics of the actual MetaDAO implementations are still being fleshed out and will likely require another 6 - 12 months to become a reality. If we wait for everything to be in place - we run the risk of losing the first mover opportunity that we now have in the RWA space ! Forgetting for a moment what the structure is, the reality is we desperately need to onboard more legal and credit expertise to fuel the momentum that is now starting to build with RWA and that is the fundamental objective of this SPF ; ie. making new and highly experienced legal and credit talent available to the DAO. It doesn’t necessarily have to be achieved via this Cluster approach and could, for example, be done via onboarding new resources to the Strategic Finance CU considering their expanded mandate with regards to RWA. However we also saw the opportunity here to pilot the concept of a working cluster, consider it a launch or test cluster. Am sure there will be many valuable lessons from that experience which are better learnt at this “proof-of-performance” stage rather than after a big bang switch over at scale.

content.content: Maker cannot force the MetaDAOs to onboard a cluster, but a crucial part of the pregame is to ensure high quality clusters are available for the launch of the MetaDAOs. The SPF structure or using a core unit is the best way to allocate resources to this. Alongside the funding we also need to activate the recognized launch metaDAO cluster MIP to properly decide on how many MetaDAOs we will be launching (matching one launch metaDAO with each cluster). One more thing that’s going to be important to properly support this process is to modify the SPF mip to better support the needs of clusters and ecosystem actors, while also specifying that cluster or ecosystem actor bootstrapping is the only valid use of SPFs in the pregame (and will be completely phased out post-pregame). Mainly I think what is missing the possibility of providing MKR rewards in line with what CU members are getting. I plan to make some proposals to this end in January

content.content: Hi @flipflopflapdelegate - I completely understand the confusion and am happy to engage with you and the recognized delegates as required to better explain and give you all the context. It’s an edge case and perhaps unique to my situation where as an existing Growth CU contributor a large portion of my compensation is commission based. Therefore dedicating time & bandwidth to the cluster ends up negatively impacting my variable element of compensation. This SPF proposal seeks to find a compromise where I would not be financially penalized for dedicating time to the Cluster.

content.content: Nominating @SebVentures as a comptroller for this SPF as per MIP55.
@MIP-Editors, Happy New Year ! We would like to formally submit this proposal for the January 2023 cycle.

@Recognized-Delegates With the Jan cycle now underway include some more details for this Cluster SPF; When we introduced the Viridian Cluster in October, we committed to come back with an expense budget, introduction of team members, and further details of the projects to be undertaken.  The expense budget for the current H1 2023 period is captured in this SPF. At the upcoming GnR call on the 19th Jan , we will further expand on this SPF request as well as take the opportunity to introduce the new team members we are proposing to onboard. Please find the updated list of priorities to be focused on by the cluster in this H1 2023 period;   MIP81 ( Coinbase USDC Institutional Rewards ) - Legal & Credit Assessment MIP88 ( Redwood RMBS ) - Legal & Credit Assessment MIP65 ( Treasuries ETF via Sygnum ) - Enhance Onchain Reporting & Automation New Money Market Opportunities - Progress existing discussions with large TradFi players for presentation to the community Develop Cluster Framework for Monitoring & Reporting Contribute as required to RWA collateral constitution Business Development around Security Tokenization and TradFi migration onchain opportunities  Of note, two projects which were listed in our original introduction in October have since been deprioritized / postponed following initial analysis by the cluster; namely MIP82 ( Coinbase over collateralized loan ) and MIP89 ( Arrow Global Credit Fund ).
